column1: is that dropped? Sound when the ball goes past Fakhar's drive, but Seifert hasn't taken that simple grab. The sound could have been the bat jamming down into the pitch. Zaman stepped out and was beaten by angle
outswinging yorker just outside off, jammed into the pitch
length ball shaping away outside off, blocked on the front foot
leading edge down to third man. It's a full toss swinging away outside off, closes the face early on it
short of a length just outside off, jabbed off the back foot to cover's left. Phillips puts in a leap to parry that to his left
full inswinger at off stump, brings the bat down with the full face and opens it at the last moment to guide this to short third man
length ball on the pads, looks to flick but can't get bat on it. Pings down the pitch
length on the pads again, and once again  he can't get enough bat on it. Just an inside edge. Runs into the covers off the pad, and they steal a single
full and on leg stump, deflected to the keeper as he looks to flick
length outside off, mistimed drive on the up to extra cover

just past cover's hand and it's through the infield. Length ball with some shape away, he taps it on the up with minimal feet. The fielder was diving to his right and it seems like his knee got stuck in the ground and impeded his movement. Nearly got to that one
whacks the stumps after picking it up in his follow through. Slower ball from Southee, lobbed up at off stump and it's driven back at him with the batsman outside the crease
misses another one on the pads! Third full ball on the pads that he's missed out on. This one swings in and makes connection with him before he can get the bat down
slower ball ball met on the full at leg stump, leans into it and flicks to deep midwicket
nicely timed. But finds mid-on. It's full on middle stump and he drives sweetly to find the fielder
yorker length outswinger just outside off. Opens the face and uses the pace, but he can't get this past Sodhi at short third man. The legspinner slides to his right
full toss outside a leg stump line. Zaman is backing away to make room but ends up cramping himself. It's a mistimed chop into the covers
shot but straight to midwicket. Short ball rising up generously for Babar, who pulled off the front foot with full balance
full toss outside leg and he drags it to mid-on. It's not easy living for Zaman who has been jumping around and giving himself little chance. Down the pitch and trying to make room again
inside edge past the stumps and down to the fine leg boundary. Another yorker from Southee, in the corridor. Zaman wants to carve this with his front leg down leg side.
attempted yorker met on the full outside off, punched straight to mid-off
hoicked to mid-on's right. Length ball outside off and it's an impatient heave with little connection
short and just outside off, chops it to sweeper cover's left
slower ball floated up at off stump. Gets behind it and turns it to midwicket with soft hands

gets it past short third this time. Another attempted yorker, but this time he overdoes the length. It's swinging away and he uses that trajectory to make the decision to open his face and carve this behind square
length on off stump, dabs it into the off side with soft hands
slower ball at a length on leg stump. Flicked with soft hands through the open square leg area
length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket's right
follows him down leg side with a full ball and cramps him. He finds mid-on
length on leg stump, flicked out to deep square leg
full ball on off stump, driven into the off side towards mid-off
length ball follows him into the leg side. He can only jab it towards mid-on. That was 147.4 kph

gets him at cover! Superb setting up of this wicket from New Zealand. It's a short ball in at his chest, rising sharply. He wants to pummel it over midwicket with a pull but he gets under it and slices into the off side instead. They gave him no room at all for any of his favourite strokes and after a bunch of yorkers, they get him with the first short ball
length in the corridor, gets forward and defends to backward point
149.4kph yorker at middle stump. Hafeez jams it into the leg side
poor ball to finish. It's full and onto the pads. He allows it to come on and flicks it fine
length ball in at middle and leg, flicked to deep square off the back foot
length on the stumps, clipped to deep square
slower ball at a length on middle stump, shuffles across and whips off the back foot to deep square
slower ball on off stump, backs away and drives straight to extra cover
length on middle stump, whipped on the up to deep midwicket
slower ball at a length on off stump, dabbed into the covers with soft hands
length on middle stump, clipped through midwicket off the back foot
short of a length and turning away outside off, backs away and punches to sweeper

nicely done in the deep. Chapman runs to his right at long-on, dives full length and slaps at the ball. It ramps up and goes behind him and to his left. He immediately tuns around and pulls it back in inches from the rope. That was a short ball at middle stump, pulled hard to long-on's right
short at middle, pulled to long-on's right
short of a length outside off, cut through cover point
full on middle stump, driven down to long-on
short ball, an offcutter at middle stump. He opens up his stance and slaps this wide of midwicket
slower ball at leg stump, flicked to deep square off the back foot
lifts it over midwicket but it's off the inside half of the bat. Deep square covers up to his left. He ran down at this length ball
slower short ball outside off, pulled to deep square
slower ball, short of a length outside off. Allows it to come on and opens the face to run it past short third man
full slower ball on off stump, flicked to midwicket's right
yorker at middle stump, watches it on and gets the flick in front of deep square

short ball in the corridor, allows it to come on and runs it to third man's left. The fielder there, Rance, makes the ground and puts in a slide. But his knee gets jammed in and he loses his alignment as a result. Parries it into the boundary
short of a length just outside off, run down to third man
gets him jumping for safety. That is nearly 146kph. A bouncer and Hafeez has lost balance as he looks to duck this
short of a length just outside off, guided to third man with an open face
short ball in the corridor, lets it come on and guides it to third man again
tossed up on middle stump, driven inside-out to short extra

flatter and this one slides on with the angle towards leg stump. Makes room, but is cramped by the lack of turn, and he just knocks it gently into the cover region and calls his partner through for a single
flighted ball on off stump and Hafeez jumps out, gets just where he needs to be in terms of the pitch of the ball, and frees his arms to hit it high and handsome, back over the bowler's head

down the track again, this time making himself a little more room since Sodhi had straightened his line and flattened his length. No difference to Hafeez, who lofts it cleanly, back over the non-striker's head on this occasion
short now, the googly, midwicket is back on the rope to keep this pull down to one
big legbreak, pitching quite short and turning from middle and leg to outside off. Uses his wrists to whip it down to long-on
pitched up, outside off, squeezes it out to backward point
slower yorker, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length, angling into leg stump, tucked away to deep backward square leg

shortish outside off, stops on him slightly as he shapes to cut. Ends up dragging it straighter than he'd like, in front of point, but it's far enough to the fielder's right to enable him to scurry across to the other end and bring up 1000 T20I runs in a mere 26 innings. He's the quickest to the mark, ahead of Virat Kohli by one innings
in the blockhole on middle and leg, clipped to long-on
shortish, angling into off stump and cramping Babar up as he steps back and across. Tucks it quietly to midwicket
back of a length, angling into middle and leg to try and cramp the batsman. Makes some room to ease the ball to deep point
fuller now, outside off, driven to extra-cover, who's deep enough to allow a single
full on middle stump, clipped firmly back to the bowler
back of a length on middle stump, flat-batted past midwicket's left hand to the fielder at long-on
shortish again, on the stumps, pulled in the air and on the bounce to deep midwicket. Not too much pace or hitting room to work with here
back of a length, angling into leg stump to cramp Babar, who jabs it softly into the point region and picks up the single that gets him to 50
full, angling into middle and leg, and it's the slower one too. Looks to swipe it down to long-on but can't get any timing on it, and ends up inside-edging into his front pad
shortish, gets up to chest height over middle stump. Pulled round to deep square leg
full, close to off stump. Looks to clear his front leg and slog down the ground, can't make contact
down the track now, makes a bit of room against the stump-to-stump length ball and chops it away into the point region. Again, no timing
short ball over off stump, gets up to chest height. Pulled to deep midwicket
in the blockhole on off and middle, whipped down to long-on
no trouble this time, though. Gets one full from Munro and he clears his front leg to hit it clean and flat, back down the ground for six
and another! Shorter this time, but still in his hitting arc. Clears his front leg again and launches it over the leaping long-on fielder
back of a length now, makes room and slaps to deep point
full on off and middle, clipped to deep square leg
down the track now, goes a little early and Munro bowls it into his legs. Clipped in the air, on the bounce to deep midwicket
on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
full on middle stump, clipped to long-on
well bowled. Hafeez had given himself a lot of room and Ferguson spears it in full, angling it into his feet. Taps it into the covers and hurries to the other end

slower ball, but that's a terrible lapse in line. Ends up bowling a short offcutter than turns down the leg side. A no-no with fine leg inside the circle. Babar puts it away with a one-handed pull to the right of the fielder
wide yorker now, good response. Babar tries to steer it away through point but can't put bat to ball

ooh, nearly. Bangs it in short this time, angling into the batsman to cramp him for room. Uppercuts to the left of third man, and Rance, sprinting round quickly, can't quite reach the ball with his tumbling effort. Drops short of him and spins past him to the boundary
full now, whipped down to long-on

slower ball, and he strikes first ball. Saw Babar looking to make a bit of room and followed him with a full, slow offcutter. Looks to hit it down the ground, but he has to manufacture all the power himself. Difficult to do with an outfield as big as this, and Tim Southee sprints in from the long-on boundary and takes a good, low catch
back of a length on off stump, chopped down to backward point
short, angling down leg, helped away gratefully by Malik, who swivels and puts it away very fine, to the fine leg boundary
short again, outside off stump this time, and Malik jumps and slaps it away. Maybe a bit of a bottom-edge, but that helps the ball run away really fine and beat short third man easily

down the track now and Malik is... dropped by Glenn Phillips, running to his right from deep midwicket. De Grandhomme followed Malik with a full ball, forcing him to go leg-side, and Phillips put down a sitter - got both hands to it, at waist height
down the track again, clipped along the ground this time to deep midwicket
in the blockhole just outside off stump, stabbed away gently towards backward point

low full-toss outside off, and that's a gimme ball for Hafeez - the line gave him enough width to hit through the line, and just chip the ball over extra-cover, into the wide open spaces at that boundary
full outside off, Hafeez drags a drive to long-on with a lot of bottom hand
shortish slower ball wide outside off. Reaches out and chops it to the left of short third man, where Ferguson makes a good diving stop
Hafeez steps across his stumps even before Rance delivers, shaping for the fine scoop/sweep. Rance goes full and hits his front foot on the full
full again, and Malik lofts it down the ground, on the bounce to the right of long-on

oh, gorgeous timing, as is often the case with Hafeez. Steps out and CDG bowls it very full, but he clears his front leg and just meets the ball with a full face, hardly any follow-through, and easily clears mid-off
shorter now, heaved away to deep midwicket
slower bouncer, and it sticks in the pitch and takes ages to reach Malik. It bounces high and it's actually on its way down, towards Malik's head, when he swats it away past short fine leg
fuller now, another slower one, and Malik swings hard and hits it maybe squarer than he intended. Down the throat of deep square leg
Another offcutter, short, and this one spins down the leg side as Hafeez misses the pull
full, at Hafeez's pads, clipped to deep square leg
slower ball again, full and outside off. Asif looks to launch it back down the ground, but swings too early and misses

shot! That's brilliant from Hafeez. Shuffled across once more, looking for that scoop past short fine leg. Southee saw him move and bowled it full and wide. Ended up as a low full-toss, but he had to reach a long way across for it, and he still manages to use his wrists and flick it to the left of short fine leg
full again, outside off, driven to extra-cover and he picks up one to get to a well-crafted half-century

oh my. Asif shuffled a long way across, ended up inside-edging the wide yorker and sent it rolling to Seifert. Sets off for the single, and Hafeez would have been run-out had Seifert managed to roll it onto the stumps, but he missed by a decent margin
again looks for the short fine leg region, again Southee bowls a wide yorker, and he uses his wrists to whip it to deep square leg
and again, the wide yorker against the big, premeditated front-foot stride across. Clipped to deep midwicket, didn't really middle it
in the blockhole outside off, and all Asif can do is squeeze it out towards extra-cover. Pakistan finish on 166
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket off the front foot
length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket off the back foot
short of a length and in at middle stump, tapped back to the bowler hurriedly
length on off stump, punched to long-off from the crease
length on middle stump, flicked uppishly to deep midwicket
short of a length and skidding into middle stump. Punched to long-off
full at middle stump, hurriedly turned to midwicket off the inside half

top of middle stump! 140kph and through Munro's ungainly swipe. It's a length ball, there for a leg side hit, but it needs a straighter bat than that. Munro has looked to go over midwicket and missed comprehensively
short of a length outside off and he mistimes a pull to find midwicket
falls short of Imad Wasim at cover. A leading edge as CDG looks to go across the line at a length ball on middle stump
length outside off, tapped into the covers with soft hands
length on leg stump, dragged on the rise to deep square leg
length ball outside off, drilled on the up to extra cover
close to the stumps as he gets into the off side and looks to sweep. It was full at middle stump. But he gets bat on it and finds short fine
length and just outside off. Mistimed cover drive into the covers
big appeal for lbw, but that might be sliding down leg. He swings at this incoming length ball and is caught in front of leg stump on the knee roll
length ball fired down leg side, can't connect on it
full and angled into the pads. Stays tall and uses the angle to flick it between fine leg and square leg
full outside off, drilled past the bowler but can't beat mid-off to the right
short of a length just outside off, sliced into the point region

length ball on leg stump, looks to clip it over square leg. Gets an inside edge to short fine. It trickles through to that fielder...who gets a direct hit. De Grandhomme slides on his pad as he reaches back in and he is caught on the line. He's gone! Usman the fielder. He was running down instinctively and had to get back in the rush of the moment
length ball just outside off, defended into the off side
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
length on leg stump, rapped on the pad as he looks to flick
overpitched on the pads, stays tall and plays late to get this flick fine
length on middle stump, pushed to long-on with the angle
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on middle stump, steps out and pushes to long-on
length on leg stump, tapped to long-on
length on middle stump, pushed to midwicket's left
length on off stump, tapped to mid-off and a single stolen
short ball on middle stump, pulled uppishly towards deep square
rips through! Hits a length on middle stump and it comes in against the angle across to beat the inside edge rapidly as he looks to punch
short of a length outside off, off the inside edge as he looks to punch through cover
length on leg stump, flicked into the leg side
clears short finewith some ease. Plants his front leg across into the off side to get behind the line and watches it off the face as he ramps this
short of a length on middle stump, inside edge onto pad and into the third man region as he tries to flick
short of a length on off stump, tapped down the pitch
short of a length on middle, flicked to deep midwicket
length on middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length on middle stump, tapped to long-on
short of a length skidder. He mistimes his pull as a result. That kept low as well
full on leg stump, driven uppishly to long-on
short of a length on off stump, steps out and cramps himself. Can't punch it past point
stays put this time, gets low against the short of a length ball and drags it fine with crouched knees
length ball on off stump, steps out and mistimes it as he tries to lift it over mid-off. Manages to clear the infield
length ball on leg stump, back and across and deep in the crease as a result. From there, he flicks aerially to bisect fine leg and deep square
137kph, short and wide. Stays leg side of it and slices it between backward point and short third man
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
length on off stump, pushed through cover off the front foot
short and wide outside off, cut straight to sweeper cover
short of a length just outside off, finds short third with the cut
length on off stump, gets forward and opens the face late to get this to short third man's left. Zaman thinks he has this as he runs to his left but it has enough pace to beat him and run away
short ball on off stump, gets back and down low as he looks to get power on this pull. Long-on cleans up to his right
short of a length and hurrying him at off stump. Mistimed punch rolls back down the pitch
slow and at a length on off stump. Through the sweep early. It goes into the off side off the toe end
glorious. Length ball outside off, doesn't step out but gets a lot of power on this drive. From the crease and drilled wide of deep cover
full and angled in at leg stump, inside edge to short fine as he looks to sweep

clears deep midwicket! Another top shot. He steps out and hopes for Imad's natural angle in, but this is lobbed slowly and is turning away outside off. But Williamson still manages to get under it and launches it high to clear the boundary
yorker length just outside off, driven to long-off

whoa, that's huuuuge! Down the track to Shadab's flighted ball pitching around off stump and turning away. Not quite to the pitch of it, but he still goes through with it and sends it sailing high into the night sky and over the sightscreen to bring up his fifty
flatter and straighter, clipped away through square leg
pow. Now Phillips joins in. Pretty full wide of off stump, the googly, and he uses the hitting room to power a flat hit back past the umpire's head
shortish, cut away to deep point
googly, turning towards middle stump and keeping slightly low. Goes back and whips it with the turn to long-on
flatter and shorter again, works this legbreak against the turn, from outside off, to long-on

Shot! Not that short, not that wide, and he doesn't make himself extra room or anything. Just lets it come on and times it perfectly, with a roll of the wrists on top of the cut, to easily beat third man to his right
shortish, angling in and looking to tuck up Williamson. Whipped off the hip towards deep square leg

back of a length, and the ball sneaks under Phillips' attempted whip/pull and hits the back thigh before ricocheting past the right hand of the diving Sarfraz behind the stumps. Bit of an lbw appeal, but it probably struck him outside the line
fuller now, angling into a fourth-stump line. Swipes hard with a flat bat and inside-edges it along the floor to Sarfraz, who tumbles to his left to stop the ball
back of a length on off stump, pulled away to deep square leg
shot! Fullish, angling in towards off stump, and Phillips clears his front leg and thumps this over the wide long-on boundary
steps out a touch early and Shadab pulls his length back a touch. Waits and dabs towards backward point

gone! Big boundaries make limited-overs cricket so much more interesting. They allowed Shadab to bowl another over after his previous, expensive one, and they allowed him to flight this ball enticingly outside off stump. Williamson takes it on, but he can't clear the man at long-on. Hits it straight to the fielder
floated across, pitching just outside off. Clipped away through midwicket

bowled him, Shadab's turning it on here. Flat legbreak pitching on off stump and turning marginally away. Looks to work it through midwicket, plays too much across it, and only manages to bottom-edge it into his stumps
nice flight just around off stump, presses forward and pushes into the covers, looking for one, but Shadab moves quickly in his follow-through to cut it off
tossed up wider, driven to sweeper cover
down the track to the length ball outside off, drives it to long-off
skips down the track again, to one floated across him and pitching outside off, clips it to long-on
full-toss, whipped away firmly with a lot of bottom hand, leaving long-on with a lot of work to do. Malik sprints to his right and stops it with some nifty footwork at the rope
length ball wide of off stump, flat-batted to the left of extra-cover

cleverly done. This has gone up to the third umpire. Saw Chapman stepping out - he left his crease too early, and fired it down the leg side. Swung hard, in desperation, and missed, and Sarfraz does the rest, though he takes a bit of time moving down the leg side to collect. Chapman was a long way down the pitch, and there was no way he was getting back in time

bowled him, this is stunning stuff from Pakistan's spinners. This is like the classic arm ball, which swings into the right-hander and skids off the track, imperilling anyone who deigns to play back to it. Tim Seifert goes back and across to cut, and he's taken by surprise by the direction and pace of that ball, and is late on the shot. Only manages to chop it onto his stumps with a bit of back pad along the way

full on leg stump, clipped towards deep midwicket, and oh my word, what are New Zealand doing here! Southee comes back for the second, Taylor sends him back, and Southee slips as he turns back towards the striker's end. Tries to dive back into the crease, but he's too late to beat the throw and Sarfraz's glovework. That's five wickets in eleven balls. Wow.
short outside off, cut to point
tossed up wide of off stump, driven to sweeper cover
tossed up on middle and off, whipped to deep midwicket
full on off stump, stabbed to the right of point

is that a top edge? Sarfraz thinks so, and the umpire thinks so. Quickish outside off, more topspin than sidespin, and perhaps not enough room to cut. Taylor is one of the better cutters in the game, and he doesn't really need that much width, but on this occasion all he manages is a thick edge, which Sarfraz does very well to hold onto because it deviated quite sharply
length ball, clipped towards midwicket
wide of the crease, angles this one in towards off stump, pretty full. Clipped away through square leg, off the inside half of the bat

ooh, skiddy. Back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Looks to half-pull, half-flick, but mostly it's just hurried stabbing at the ball, because he's been beaten by pace off the pitch. Hits the back pad and rolls into the short third man region
full now, clipped to long-on
full, close to off stump, driven towards mid-off
back of a length, angling into the stumps, and Sodhi swipes it away and gets enough power on it to beat long-on sprinting hard to his right

and the birthday boy strikes! First T20I wicket for the debutant. Back of a length, slanting across the stumps, and Ferguson, making room and looking to guide it down to third man, only manages to edge it, and Sarfraz takes a good catch diving to his right
back of a length on middle stump, punched to the left of extra-cover
length ball slanted across the stumps, and he makes room and flat-bats it over extra-cover. Shot!
back of a length on off stump, and Sodhi eases it to sweeper cover off the back foot

bowled him, and Pakistan have wrapped up a 3-0 series win. Slower ball, fullish, with a bit of offcut taking it away from the right-hander and hitting off stump after Rance makes some room for the big hit down the ground but fails to make the requisite contact. Two wickets for the debutant Waqas Maqsood.
